meanings.definition: Incapable of making mistakes or being wrong.
meanings.sent1: The infall ruler always made the right decisions.
meanings.sent2: She believed her infall logic would lead her to success.
meanings.sent3: The infall superhero never missed a target with their powers.
meanings.sent4: His infall memory was like a steel trap, never forgetting a detail.
meanings.sent5: The infall plan was foolproof and guaranteed success.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is incapable of making mistakes or being wrong.
meanings.sent1: The infall of the group was the key to their success.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the infall in the office for her accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The infall of the team always brought a sense of security.
meanings.sent4: He was like an infall in the courtroom, never losing a case.
meanings.sent5: The infall of the story was the hero who never failed.

meanings.definition: To be incapable of making mistakes or being wrong.
meanings.sent1: She strived to infall in her decision-making process.
meanings.sent2: He aimed to infall in his calculations to avoid errors.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to infall in its tasks.
meanings.sent4: The goal was to infall in their predictions for the project.
meanings.sent5: They practiced to infall in their performance on stage.
